notesStmt.note: Incomplete at the beginning and at the end. Light and damp damage at edges. Occasional darkening into margins. A little rodent damage at edge.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 40 quires of mostly 10 leaves each, marked with catchwords and signatures in Hebrew letters at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 11th to 12th century.

binding.p: Pre-1600. Black leather. Spine: 'Nathan ben Jechiel. Arukh Sive Lexicon Talmudicum. Hebr. Brit. Mus. Add. Or. 26,881.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Samuel Schönblum of Vienna: purchased by the British Museum on 24 August 1865: inscribed, folio [401v] (fse001v).
